channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Towards Ultra-High-Definition Image Deraining: A Benchmark and An Efficient Method
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the task of UHD image deraining, and contribute the first large-scale UHD image deraining dataset, 4K-Rain13k, that contains 13, 000 image pairs at 4K resolution.

item.title: Content-Style Decoupling for Unsupervised Makeup Transfer without Generating Pseudo Ground Truth
item.description: This assumption allows CSD-MT to decouple the content and makeup style information in each face image through the frequency decomposition.

item.title: Survival of the Fittest Representation: A Case Study with Modular Addition
item.description: To investigate this Survival of the Fittest hypothesis, we conduct a case study on neural networks performing modular addition, and find that these networks' multiple circular representations at different Fourier frequencies undergo such competitive dynamics, with only a few circles surviving at the end.

item.title: Autoformalizing Euclidean Geometry
item.description: One challenge in Euclidean geometry is that informal proofs rely on diagrams, leaving gaps in texts that are hard to formalize.

item.title: Transformers Can Do Arithmetic with the Right Embeddings
item.description: The poor performance of transformers on arithmetic tasks seems to stem in large part from their inability to keep track of the exact position of each digit inside of a large span of digits.

item.title: DMPlug: A Plug-in Method for Solving Inverse Problems with Diffusion Models
item.description: However, such interleaving methods struggle to produce final results that look like natural objects of interest (i. e., manifold feasibility) and fit the measurement (i. e., measurement feasibility), especially for nonlinear IPs.

item.title: Understanding Linear Probing then Fine-tuning Language Models from NTK Perspective
item.description: Our experiments with a Transformer-based model on natural language processing tasks across multiple benchmarks confirm our theoretical analysis and demonstrate the effectiveness of LP-FT in fine-tuning language models.

item.title: AutoCV: Empowering Reasoning with Automated Process Labeling via Confidence Variation
item.description: We experimentally validate that the confidence variations learned by the verification model trained on the final answer correctness can effectively identify errors in the reasoning steps.

item.title: Exploring the Performance of Continuous-Time Dynamic Link Prediction Algorithms
item.description: However, a single metric is not sufficient to fully capture the differences between DLP algorithms, and is prone to overly optimistic performance evaluation.

item.title: MVMS-RCN: A Dual-Domain Unfolding CT Reconstruction with Multi-sparse-view and Multi-scale Refinement-correction
item.description: We propose a novel dual-domain deep unfolding unified framework that offers a great deal of flexibility for multi-sparse-view CT reconstruction with different sampling views through a single model.

item.title: PatchScaler: An Efficient Patch-independent Diffusion Model for Super-Resolution
item.description: Diffusion models significantly improve the quality of super-resolved images with their impressive content generation capabilities.

item.title: Controlling Rate, Distortion, and Realism: Towards a Single Comprehensive Neural Image Compression Model
item.description: A critical obstacle of these generative NIC methods is that each model is optimized for a single bit rate.

item.title: GTA: Generative Trajectory Augmentation with Guidance for Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Our results show that GTA, as a general data augmentation strategy, enhances the performance of widely used offline RL algorithms in both dense and sparse reward settings.

item.title: Improving Data-aware and Parameter-aware Robustness for Continual Learning
item.description: The goal of Continual Learning (CL) task is to continuously learn multiple new tasks sequentially while achieving a balance between the plasticity and stability of new and old knowledge.

item.title: Rethinking Transformers in Solving POMDPs
item.description: Sequential decision-making algorithms such as reinforcement learning (RL) in real-world scenarios inevitably face environments with partial observability.

item.title: RLAIF-V: Aligning MLLMs through Open-Source AI Feedback for Super GPT-4V Trustworthiness
item.description: While traditional methods rely on labor-intensive and time-consuming manual labeling, recent approaches employing models as automatic labelers have shown promising results without human intervention.

item.title: EF-Calib: Spatiotemporal Calibration of Event- and Frame-Based Cameras Using Continuous-Time Trajectories
item.description: Leveraging the asynchronous nature of events, a derivable piece-wise B-spline to represent camera pose continuously is introduced, enabling calibration for intrinsic parameters, extrinsic parameters, and time offset, with analytical Jacobians provided.

item.title: Assessing the significance of longitudinal data in Alzheimer's Disease forecasting
item.description: In this study, we employ a transformer encoder model to characterize the significance of longitudinal patient data for forecasting the progression of Alzheimer's Disease (AD).

item.title: Match, Compare, or Select? An Investigation of Large Language Models for Entity Matching
item.description: Based on our findings, we further design a compositional entity matching (ComEM) framework that leverages the composition of multiple strategies and LLMs.

item.title: Phase Transitions in the Output Distribution of Large Language Models
item.description: Analogous phenomena have recently been observed in large language models.

item.title: Gaussian Embedding of Temporal Networks
item.description: Representing the nodes of continuous-time temporal graphs in a low-dimensional latent space has wide-ranging applications, from prediction to visualization.

item.title: A Retrospective of the Tutorial on Opportunities and Challenges of Online Deep Learning
item.description: This is done with the use of online learning or continuous ML technologies.

item.title: HDC: Hierarchical Semantic Decoding with Counting Assistance for Generalized Referring Expression Segmentation
item.description: The newly proposed Generalized Referring Expression Segmentation (GRES) amplifies the formulation of classic RES by involving multiple/non-target scenarios.

item.title: Prompt Optimization with Human Feedback
item.description: We apply our APOHF algorithm to various tasks, including optimizing user instructions, prompt optimization for text-to-image generative models, and response optimization with human feedback (i. e., further refining the response using a variant of our APOHF).

item.title: KSW: Khmer Stop Word based Dictionary for Keyword Extraction
item.description: This paper introduces KSW, a Khmer-specific approach to keyword extraction that leverages a specialized stop word dictionary.

item.title: VoCoT: Unleashing Visually Grounded Multi-Step Reasoning in Large Multi-Modal Models
item.description: While large multi-modal models (LMMs) have exhibited impressive capabilities across diverse tasks, their effectiveness in handling complex tasks has been limited by the prevailing single-step reasoning paradigm.

item.title: SCSim: A Realistic Spike Cameras Simulator
item.description: Large-scale synthetic datasets have significantly accelerated the development of these cameras, particularly in reconstruction and optical flow.

item.title: A Closer Look at Time Steps is Worthy of Triple Speed-Up for Diffusion Model Training
item.description: Training diffusion models is always a computation-intensive task.

item.title: PP-SAM: Perturbed Prompts for Robust Adaptation of Segment Anything Model for Polyp Segmentation
item.description: To this end, we utilize variable perturbed bounding box prompts (BBP) to enrich the learning context and enhance the model's robustness to BBP perturbations during inference.

item.title: Empowering Large Language Models to Set up a Knowledge Retrieval Indexer via Self-Learning
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) offers a cost-effective approach to injecting real-time knowledge into large language models (LLMs).

item.title: MultiOOD: Scaling Out-of-Distribution Detection for Multiple Modalities
item.description: Extensive experiments on MultiOOD demonstrate that training with A2D and NP-Mix improves existing OOD detection algorithms by a large margin.

item.title: CoSLight: Co-optimizing Collaborator Selection and Decision-making to Enhance Traffic Signal Control
item.description: Effective multi-intersection collaboration is pivotal for reinforcement-learning-based traffic signal control to alleviate congestion.

item.title: Model Ensembling for Constrained Optimization
item.description: In this work, we further investigate these themes by considering a setting in which we wish to ensemble models for multidimensional output predictions that are in turn used for downstream optimization.

item.title: Superpixelwise Low-rank Approximation based Partial Label Learning for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel superpixelwise low-rank approximation (LRA)-based partial label learning method, namely SLAP, which is the first to take into account partial label learning in HSI classification.

item.title: Effective Layer Pruning Through Similarity Metric Perspective
item.description: However, layer pruning often hurts the network predictive ability (i. e., accuracy) at high compression rates.

item.title: Advanced Language Model-based Translator for English-Vietnamese Translation
item.description: We introduce a transformative approach to English-Vietnamese translation, leveraging the cutting edge capabilities of the Gemma-7B-IT (Gemma Team et al. 2024) model.

item.title: OED: Towards One-stage End-to-End Dynamic Scene Graph Generation
item.description: Dynamic Scene Graph Generation (DSGG) focuses on identifying visual relationships within the spatial-temporal domain of videos.

item.title: DPN: Decoupling Partition and Navigation for Neural Solvers of Min-max Vehicle Routing Problems
item.description: The min-max vehicle routing problem (min-max VRP) traverses all given customers by assigning several routes and aims to minimize the length of the longest route.

item.title: Mixture of Modality Knowledge Experts for Robust Multi-modal Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: Multi-modal knowledge graph completion (MMKGC) aims to automatically discover new knowledge triples in the given multi-modal knowledge graphs (MMKGs), which is achieved by collaborative modeling the structural information concealed in massive triples and the multi-modal features of the entities.

item.title: Reason3D: Searching and Reasoning 3D Segmentation via Large Language Model
item.description: This foundational estimation facilitates a detailed, coarse-to-fine segmentation strategy that significantly enhances the precision of object identification and segmentation.

item.title: ReflectionCoder: Learning from Reflection Sequence for Enhanced One-off Code Generation
item.description: Inspired by this, we present ReflectionCoder, a novel approach that effectively leverages reflection sequences constructed by integrating compiler feedback to improve one-off code generation performance.

item.title: DoRA: Enhancing Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning with Dynamic Rank Distribution
item.description: Fine-tuning large-scale pre-trained models is inherently a resource-intensive task.

item.title: Benchmarking and Improving Bird's Eye View Perception Robustness in Autonomous Driving
item.description: In this study, we present RoboBEV, an extensive benchmark suite designed to evaluate the resilience of BEV algorithms.

item.title: Vista: A Generalizable Driving World Model with High Fidelity and Versatile Controllability
item.description: In this paper, we present Vista, a generalizable driving world model with high fidelity and versatile controllability.

item.title: Hardness-Aware Scene Synthesis for Semi-Supervised 3D Object Detection
item.description: While conventional methods focus on generating pseudo-labels for unlabeled samples as supplements for training, the structural nature of 3D point cloud data facilitates the composition of objects and backgrounds to synthesize realistic scenes.

item.title: Think Before You Act: A Two-Stage Framework for Mitigating Gender Bias Towards Vision-Language Tasks
item.description: During answer inference, GAMA integrates the image, generated narrative, and a task-specific question prompt to infer answers for different vision-language tasks.

item.title: Various Lengths, Constant Speed: Efficient Language Modeling with Lightning Attention
item.description: This eliminates the need for cumsum in the linear attention calculation.

item.title: Balancing User Preferences by Social Networks: A Condition-Guided Social Recommendation Model for Mitigating Popularity Bias
item.description: More specifically, CGSoRec first includes a Condition-Guided Social Denoising Model (CSD) to remove redundant social relations in the social network for capturing users' social preferences with items more precisely.

item.title: Spectral-Refiner: Fine-Tuning of Accurate Spatiotemporal Neural Operator for Turbulent Flows
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new Spatiotemporal Fourier Neural Operator (SFNO) that learns maps between Bochner spaces, and a new learning framework to address these issues.

item.title: GaussianFormer: Scene as Gaussians for Vision-Based 3D Semantic Occupancy Prediction
item.description: To address this, we propose an object-centric representation to describe 3D scenes with sparse 3D semantic Gaussians where each Gaussian represents a flexible region of interest and its semantic features.
